abstract: Nestlé is expected to announce that it is buying the baby food giant currently owned by Novartis, a Swiss-based company.
snippet: Nestlé is expected to announce that it is buying the baby food giant currently owned by Novartis, a Swiss-based company.
lead_paragraph: Nestlé, the world’s largest food company, is expected to announce today that it is buying the baby food giant Gerber for an estimated $5 billion, people involved in the transaction said yesterday.

headline.main: Deal Expected From Nestlé to Buy Gerber for $5 Billion
headline.print_headline: Deal Expected From Nestlé To Buy Gerber For $5 Billion

byline.original: By Andrew Martin and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: Nestlé is expected to announce that it is buying the baby food giant, which is currently own by Novartis, a Swiss-based company.
snippet: Nestlé is expected to announce that it is buying the baby food giant, which is currently own by Novartis, a Swiss-based company.
lead_paragraph: Nestlé, the world’s largest food company, is expected to announce today that it is buying the baby food giant Gerber, for an estimated $5 billion, people involved in the transaction said yesterday.

headline.main: Nestlé Expected to Buy Gerber in $5 Billion Deal

byline.original: By Andrew Martin and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: Nestlé, the world’s largest food company, agreed to buy the baby food giant Gerber for $5.5 billion in cash to extend its push into the health and wellness category. Gerber, famous for its Gerber Baby ads, is currently owned by Novartis, the Swiss pharmaceuticals company, which has been selling noncore businesses in recent years to focus on health care. Separately, Novartis said Thursday it had named Joseph Jimenez, previously of the Blackstone Group, the private equity firm, to be chief executive of its consumer health division.
lead_paragraph: Nestlé, the world’s largest food company, agreed to buy the baby food giant Gerber for $5.5 billion in cash to extend its push into the health and wellness category. Gerber, famous for its Gerber Baby ads, is currently owned by Novartis, the Swiss pharmaceuticals company, which has been selling noncore businesses in recent years to focus on health care. Separately, Novartis said Thursday it had named Joseph Jimenez, previously of the Blackstone Group, the private equity firm, to be chief executive of its consumer health division.

headline.main: Nestlé to Buy Gerber for $5.5 Billion
